title: Baltic states regain energy autonomy to counter Russian threat
summary: On Saturday, the three Baltic states disconnected their electricity grids from Russia's. This marked the end of decades of work to gain energy independence in electricity, gas and oil, against a backdrop of hybrid warfare in the Baltic Sea.

title: 200,000 march against far right in Munich
summary: With legislative elections two weeks away, massive demonstrations took place across Germany under the slogan 'democracy needs you,' warning against any party working together with the far-right AfD.

title: Dominique Méda: 'What Europe needs is not a simplification shock, but an ambition shock'
summary: In her column, the sociologist condemns the fact that there is nothing in the Commission's competitiveness program about how innovation and decarbonization efforts can be supported simultaneously.

title: Three additional Israeli hostages released in exchange for 183 Palestinian prisoners under Gaza ceasefire deal
summary: The hostages were abducted during the Hamas-led attack on Israel on October 7, 2023, that sparked the war. In exchange, Israel freed scores of Palestinian prisoners, including senior militants.

title: Elon Musk says has no plans to acquire TikTok's US operations
summary: The social media platform is facing down a US law that ordered the company to break off from its Chinese owner ByteDance or otherwise be banned in the United States over national security concerns regarding the data it gathers on users.

title: 'Kate from Kharkiv' posts dark messages on sleepless nights: 'It's not another life, a virtual one, it's mine'
summary: Kateryna Bohuslavska shares her daily life on social media, as a resident of Ukraine's second-largest city, close to the Russian border and under bombardment. For the West, she opens a window into the war, one which doesn't hide the horror.

title: Jacob Rogozinski: 'Who will forgive us if we fail to ask forgiveness for these crimes in Gaza?'
summary: The philosopher, a descendant of Holocaust survivors, expresses his indignation at the suffering inflicted on Palestinians and the refusal, by Netanyahu's government and some Israelis, to acknowledge that they are responsible for it.

title: US judge blocks Musk’s DOGE team from accessing treasury data
summary: The order issued on Saturday temporarily restricts access to data stored at the US Treasury by, among others, 'all political appointees and special government employees.'

title: French businesses are slow to adopt AI
summary: Full of promise, artificial intelligence continues to raise questions within companies: Fewer than one in two in France had invested in these technologies by 2024, compared with an average of 72% worldwide, according to a survey by software publisher Sage.

title: Robert Fico, the Slovak leader who has made Ukraine his 'enemy'
summary: The prime minister makes no secret of his closeness to Vladimir Putin's Russia rather than the European Union. This is much to the dismay of some Slovaks, who are stepping up demonstrations. The next is set for Friday, February 7.

title: At the Sarkozy-Gaddafi trial, the prosecution's case is slowly taking shape
summary: The first two weeks of hearings in this historic trial allowed the former French president to stress that there is no absolute proof of the Libyan financing of his 2007 presidential campaign. But the testimonies of those close to him have weakened his defense.

title: Lebanon's PM announces new government
summary: The incoming government named on Saturday includes five women and also well-known figures like Ghassan Salame, a former United Nations envoy to Libya.

title: Sanctions against the ICC: Trump's present to Netanyahu
summary: On Thursday, the US president issued an executive order sanctioning the International Criminal Court, imposing 'tangible and significant consequences' on those responsible for ICC 'transgressions.'

title: British trade unions warn of Amazon's relentless work pace
summary: Workers at the e-commerce giant's UK distribution centers are rapidly developing chronic pain, warn labor organizations.

title: The life of dreams and nightmares Arizona's Japanese Americans lived during the Second World War
summary: Using pictures left by her grandmother, photographer Jennifer Sakai retraces the story of her ancestors, who were sent to the Poston camp during World War II.

title: England narrowly wins against France 26-25 in Six Nations thriller
summary: England's victory ended a run of seven straight defeats by major nations.

title: Are Musk's politics hurting Tesla in Europe?
summary: Registrations plunged 63% in France in January 2025, but it should pick up again as a new model is to be released.

title: Twickenham, the birthplace of English rugby, has lost its name
summary: The French rugby team takes on England on Saturday for the second round of the Six Nations Tournament. They will play at the iconic venue, renamed Allianz Stadium.

title: Thai hostages freed from Gaza arrive in Bangkok
summary: Watchara Sriaoun, Pongsak Tanna, Sathian Suwannakham, Surasak Lamnau and Bannawat Saethao landed in Bangkok at 7:30 am (0030 GMT) on Sunday and were met by overjoyed relatives and officials from the ministry of foreign affairs.

title: High jewelry: Constellations of precious gemstones
summary: Dewdrop-shaped diamonds at Boucheron, fish brooches with iridescent scales at Van Cleef & Arpels, flowers with pink sapphire petals at Dior ... this season's creations are littered with gems.

title: Two years after the earthquake, villages in southern Turkey face expropriation
summary: The Hatay region still has 220,000 people living in container cities. Faced with the pressing demand for housing, the authorities are stepping up land seizures in rural communities, as in Hidirbey and Vakifli, 'Turkey's last Armenian village.'

title: Elections in Ecuador amid an explosion of violence
summary: An outsider elected in 2023, the incumbent president Daniel Noboa is seeking a new term after implementing a security policy criticized by human rights defenders. He was one of the few Latin American presidents invited to Donald Trump's inauguration.

title: How far will artificial intelligence go?
summary: With hundreds of billions of dollars of investment announced by the American OpenAI and the revolutionary technology of China's DeepSeek, the sector is developing at lightning speed. But there are questions surrounding a superior intelligence, along with concerns about its autonomy. Here's a look at the current state of play.
